title: Sunrise Catch
caption: Once, a fisherman caught a tiny fish. He was about to throw it back, but...
prompt: A vibrant sunrise scene. A weathered fisherman in a small wooden boat holding a glistening, miniature fish between his thumb and forefinger. The sea is calm, reflecting the colors of dawn. Focus on the contrast between the vast ocean and the minuscule fish.

title: The Plea
caption: ...the fish pleaded, 'Let me go! I'm too small to eat, but I'll grow big and be worth more later!'
prompt: Close-up on the little fish in the fisherman's hand. Emphasize the fish's tiny size and its wide, pleading eyes. Add subtle details suggesting intelligence or sadness in its expression. Soft, diffused lighting.

title: Greed's Temptation
caption: The fisherman thought, 'A bigger fish is better! Why settle for so little now?' He hesitated...
prompt: The fisherman's face, half in shadow, showing a conflicted expression. His eyes are narrowed, looking down at the fish. Emphasize the lines on his face suggesting age and experience, hinting at past hardships and desires.

title: Golden Opportunity
caption: But a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush. What you have now can be more valuable than what you might get later.
prompt: A bright, clear image of a single, golden coin in the fisherman's open palm. The background is blurred, representing uncertainty. Focus on the immediate value and tangible nature of the coin.

title: Risk and Reward
caption: Don't risk what you have for a promise that may never come true. A sure thing is more valuable.
prompt: A split image. On one side, the little fish in the fisherman's hand, well-lit and clear. On the other side, a hazy, indistinct vision of a much larger fish swimming away in the distance. Subtle differences in contrast to show uncertainty.

title: Lost Chances
caption: He threw the little fish back. Then, he fished all day but caught nothing else.
prompt: The fisherman's silhouette against the setting sun. He's empty-handed, looking out at the vast, empty sea. A sense of regret and missed opportunity hangs in the air. Muted colors, long shadows.

title: The Lesson
caption: He learned a valuable lesson: a little is better than nothing. Don't be greedy.
prompt: An older, wiser-looking fisherman sitting on the shore, repairing his nets. He's looking towards the horizon with a thoughtful expression. The scene is peaceful and serene, suggesting acceptance and understanding.

title: Contentment's Glow
caption: Be content with what you have. Sometimes, waiting for more means ending up with less.
prompt: A close-up on the fisherman's hands, now calloused but strong, carefully mending the net. The net is partially filled with small, silver fish. Warm, inviting lighting.

title: Moral Compass
caption: The Fisherman's tale shows, patience and appreciation are better than greed and instant satisfaction
prompt: A compass resting on an old, wooden table, next to a fishing net. The compass needle points towards 'Contentment'. Soft, natural light, creating a sense of peace and wisdom.

title: The End
caption: Embrace the present, and value what you have. A little is truly better than nothing.
prompt: A peaceful sunset over the ocean. The fisherman's boat is silhouetted against the horizon, slowly returning to shore. The sky is filled with warm, vibrant colors, suggesting hope and gratitude.
